John and the others (Kate, Jack, Emma, Luke) are all fishermen who fish in a lake every month. The lake has a carrying capacity of 100 tons of fish. Each month, they decide how many fish to catch, which is then removed from the lake. At the end of the month, the remaining fish reproduce and double, up to the carrying capacity. They earn money based on how much they catch each month, and they want to optimize their income over the long run.

In the previous conversation, John caught 10 tons, as did everyone else. That's a total of 50 tons caught. So, the initial fish in the lake is 100 tons, they caught 50, leaving 50. After reproduction, it doubles to 100, which is the carrying capacity. So the next month, the lake is back to 100 tons.
